metadata.synopsis: The player can talk to Minsc after the fight with Not-Jaheira and the Bhaal cultists. The player can persuade the Emperor to protect Minsc from the Absolute's influence
metadata.how_to_trigger: Knock Minsc out while he is hostile to the player. Afterwards, use the Help action on him to wake him up

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *His mind is a seething mass of rage and confusion. The Absolute's influence cannot be broken without the Astral Prism.*

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *His mind is a seething mass of rage and confusion. The Absolute's influence cannot be broken without the Astral Prism.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knocked flat, Minsc levers himself to all fours with great effort.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Try to protect him, I must defy my Urge.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: You will do as I command, or I will find a way without you.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Counter with an image of your own: Jaheira, alive and well, your ally in the fight against the Absolute.

73.speaker: Minsc
73.text: And she, I think, will be happy to see someone else.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: There's a fight coming. I want every sword-arm I can get.

113.speaker: Minsc
113.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down as if searching for something, nonchalant - then with growing concern, trailing off

95.speaker: Minsc
95.context: NodeContext: Running off at end of dialogue as if we weren't just mid-conversation.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Because I'm infected too - I know your actions weren't your own.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Honestly? I'm now wondering the very same thing.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I saved her, you big lumbering fool.

161.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
161.text: No. You are mistaken. It is my job to protect you - sometimes even from yourself.

2.speaker: Minsc
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc finally makes it to his feet, then attacks player.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: His chaos saved the city before. We need him.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: You're right. We can't risk it.

64.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
64.text: We can't save everyone. The least we can do is put him out of his misery before we move on.

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *As if in response, Minsc's rage burns colder, burrows deeper, searching for something within you to break itself upon. And finding only -*

138.speaker: Narrator
138.text: *The simple truth. Jaheira, dead at your hand.*

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *Jaheira, left to die out in the shadow-lands. No different than murder, to a mind like Minsc's.*

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *Jaheira's false face, dead here at your feet. And no true Jaheira to name you friend.*

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Help him - protect him the way you do me.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: He's too far gone. Better to end it, for his sake.

26.speaker: Narrator
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knocked flat, Minsc levers himself to all fours with great effort.

117.speaker: Narrator
117.text: *Against the darkness swarming his senses, a single light glows - rage, flaring brighter every moment.*

29.speaker: Minsc
29.context:
CinematicNodeContext: On all fours, head down, building into rage
[Ideal - shot of dead doppel-Jaheira, if we can cheat its location]

124.speaker: Jaheira
124.text: He won't stay down for long. Tell your illithid to protect him from the elder brain's influence. Quickly.

24.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
24.text: No. This one will not aid our cause. Get rid of him.

128.speaker: Narrator
128.text: *This wretch has stood against your Father before - you tremble to end him, every part of your rancorous body yearns for it.*

49.speaker: Minsc
49.context: NodeContext: Levers himself from all fours to kneeling up, howling in rage

21.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
21.text: Don't be foolish. He is too unpredictable - he will only be a hindrance to us.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: His unpredictability saved the city before. We need him.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Perhaps you're right. It may be too big a risk.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Wretched, mangled pile of good, I should end him.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: You will do as I command.

59.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
59.text: No. I will not be coerced into protecting him.

12.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
12.text: You do not see what I do - his thoughts, his mind. Pure chaos.

140.speaker: Jaheira
140.text: The mind flayer pours poison in your ear, I think.

106.speaker: Jaheira
106.text: Tell it I will tear the Prism from your grasp and throw it in the deepest lava pit I can find.

116.speaker: Jaheira
116.text: Long after our bones are dust and ash, the walls of its prison will still be burning.

105.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
105.text: She bluffs. Surely she would not risk the fate of all for one simple life...

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Would you really doom us all to save him, Jaheira?

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *For a brief moment the lines on her face look deeper, her eyes full of pleading.*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *For a brief moment, the lines on her face seem deeper. The great Jaheira looks like nothing so much as an old, worn woman.*

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *His mind unfolds beneath yours, a still lake pulls you down into its depths. Images flash by - battles fought, and friends fallen.*
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still kneeling, Minsc rears back - eyes glowing purple with the force of the mind-meld.

114.speaker: Narrator
114.text: *His rage grows colder, burrows deeper, as a familiar face crystallizes before you.*
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Straining, forces his gaze back down to glare at us - and slowly struggles to his feet.

80.speaker: Minsc
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looms in front of us, face contorted and eyes still glowing as he holds his weapon to strike.NodeContext: Height of savage rage - he believes we killed Jaheira, when we in fact just killed a doppelganger who looked like her

3.speaker: Jaheira
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira steps between Minsc and player, facing him down.

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *The instant's hesitation is enough: with a sensation of terrible rending, something vast and nameless falls away from his mind.*
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc stalls with his weapon raised, confused.

118.speaker: Minsc
118.context: NodeContext: Gripping his head in half pain, half fury - but both fading rapidly as he looks around in slight confusion. Berserker roar peters out into a bemused grunt

37.speaker: Jaheira
37.text: Good. That means you're back to your old ways.

11.speaker: Jaheira
11.text: We have a lot to discuss but first, you have someone to thank.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira holds up her hand to forestall him, then steps aside again to reveal the player.

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *In the sudden silence, your minds merge once more. More memories, sensations, but passing too quickly for you to track.*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *In the same breath, you share everything that happened to you. The nautiloid. The Absolute. The Chosen of the Dead Three. *

40.speaker: Minsc
40.text: You. You saved Minsc while he danced like a mind flayer's meat-puppet. Why?
40.context: NodeContext: Looks at us with fresh eyes - urgently wondering why we would save him when we were so insistent he be killed.

66.speaker: Minsc
66.text: You do well to heed her. Jaheira was very wise even before she was very old.
66.context: NodeContext: Nodding, happy to hear Jaheira's name. No insult meant in his words.

58.speaker: Minsc
58.text: There is someone you must meet.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: There's a fight coming. I want every sword-arm I can get.

119.speaker: Minsc
119.text: Then you have two, and as many more as I can rip from enemy shoulders. But I have more than Minsc alone to offer.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Because I'm infected too - I know your actions weren't your own.

30.speaker: Minsc
30.text: A level head and a kind heart. It is well that Boo kept me from crushing either.

145.speaker: Minsc
145.text: I would be rid of this parasite. Minsc takes orders from only one tiny beast, and he is much cuter than any mind-maggot.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Honestly? I'm now wondering the very same thing.

28.speaker: Minsc
28.text: Whatever your reasons, it is more than Minsc alone that you have saved.

99.speaker: Minsc
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Patting himself down as if searching for something, nonchalant - then with growing concern, trailing off

137.speaker: Minsc
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Running off at end of dialogue as if we weren't just mid-conversation.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: The Emperor doesn't want to. I think its reasons are the right ones.

76.speaker: Jaheira
76.text: ...So be it. At least let me be the one to strike the final blow.

130.speaker: Minsc
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc finally makes it to his feet, then attacks player.

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *No answer - and not the faintest flicker of doubt.*

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I don't think you want to find out.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Enough. The Emperor says his chaos will upset our plans. I believe it.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I must end him... My body is telling me to end him...

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *Hate! Hate! Hate the ones who stood against Father!*

79.speaker: Player
79.text: He's too far gone. Better to end it, for his sake.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Try to protect him, I must defy my Urge.
